articles.description: All the latest football news as Wales reach their first major women's tournament, plus Premier League reaction and build-up.
articles.title: Wales reach Euro 2025 and Premier League reaction, Leicester, West Ham, Lopetegui

articles.description: His Leicester side had to ride their luck at times against West Ham, but victory for a smiling Ruud van Nistelrooy is already giving Foxes fans their "belief" back.
articles.title: Ruud van Nistelrooy: Smiling Dutchman brings belief back to Leicester after West Ham win

articles.description: Ollie Pope will again keep wicket for England after the tourists named an unchanged team for the second Test against New Zealand in Wellington.
articles.title: New Zealand v England: Ollie Pope picked again as wicketkeeper in unchanged team

articles.description: German Cup holders Bayer Leverkusen progress to the quarter-finals as they narrowly beat 10-man Bayern Munich.
articles.title: Bayern Munich 0-1 Bayer Leverkusen: Nathan Tella scores in German Cup

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton will race for Mercedes for the final time on Sunday as driver and team part after "12 incredible years".
articles.title: Lewis Hamilton leaving Mercedes: 'A bittersweet ending, but the achievements remain indelible'

articles.description: Tiger Woods suggests that each American player in the Ryder Cup should receive $5m (£3.9m) and give that money to charity.
articles.title: Tiger Woods: US Ryder Cup players should get $5m and donate to charity

articles.description: The New York Knicks and Milwaukee Bucks earn their places in the NBA Cup quarter-finals with decisive wins.
articles.title: Knicks and Bucks advance to NBA Cup knockouts

articles.description: Novak Djokovic will play at the Brisbane International this month before he starts his bid for a 25th Grand Slam at the Australian Open in Melbourne.
articles.title: Novak Djokovic to play Brisbane International before Australia Open

articles.description: Wales’ most-capped player and record goalscorer Jess Fishlock says qualifying for a major tournament with her country is “the proudest moment of her life".
articles.title: Jess Fishlock: Wales in first finals 'proudest moment' for veteran

articles.description: Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi writes 'Jesus loves you' on his rainbow captain's armband for Tuesday's match at Ipswich Town.
articles.title: Marc Guehi: Crystal Palace captain writes on rainbow captain's armband despite FA reminder
